intro: Androsace strigillosa var. mutica, commonly known as the hairy mouse ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a short, narrow tube. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
